lpOptSMTTable.name: lpOptSMTTable
lpOptSMTTable.description: A list of optional SMT entries. The number of entries shall not exceed the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber.

lpOptSMTEntry.name: lpOptSMTEntry
lpOptSMTEntry.description: An optional SMT entry containing information common to a given optional SMT.

lpOptSMTIndex.name: lpOptSMTIndex
lpOptSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptSMTManufacturerOUI.name: lpOptSMTManufacturerOUI
lpOptSMTManufacturerOUI.description: The three octets of manufacturer data which make up the manufacturerOUI component.

lpOptSMTManufacturerData.name: lpOptSMTManufacturerData
lpOptSMTManufacturerData.description: The 29 octets of manufacturer data which make up the manufacturerData component.

lpOptSMTHoldState.name: lpOptSMTHoldState
lpOptSMTHoldState.description: This variable indicates the current state of the Hold function. The value 'not-holding' is the default and initial value. The value must be set to 'not-holding' as part of Active_Actions and when the conditions causing 'holding-prm' or 'holding-sec' are no longer true. The value 'holding-prm' must be set when the condition (notTR_Flag & not RE_Flag & (PC_LS=QLS | LEM_Fail | TNE>NS_Max | (not LS_Flag & TPC > T_Out))) is satisfied in state PC8:ACTIVE for the A Port. The value 'holding-sec' must be set when the condition (notTR_Flag & not RE_Flag & (PC_LS=QLS | LEM_Fail | TNE>NS_Max | (not LS_Flag & TPC > T_Out))) is satisfied in state PC8:ACTIVE for the B Port.

lpOptSMTSetCount.name: lpOptSMTSetCount
lpOptSMTSetCount.description: This variable is composed of a count incremented in response to a Set operation on the MIB, and the time of the change, however only the count is reported here (refer to ANSI SMT 8.4.1).

lpOptSMTLastSetStationId.name: lpOptSMTLastSetStationId
lpOptSMTLastSetStationId.description: The Station ID of the station that effected the last change in the FDDI MIB.

lpOptMACBridgeFunctionTable.name: lpOptMACBridgeFunctionTable
lpOptMACBridgeFunctionTable.description: A list of MAC bridge function entries.

lpOptMACBridgeFunctionEntry.name: lpOptMACBridgeFunctionEntry
lpOptMACBridgeFunctionEntry.description: Bridge function information for a given MAC within a given SMT.

lpOptMACBridgeFunctionSMTIndex.name: lpOptMACBridgeFunctionSMTIndex
lpOptMACBridgeFunctionSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptMACBridgeFunctionMACIndex.name: lpOptMACBridgeFunctionMACIndex
lpOptMACBridgeFunctionMACIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the MAC object instances.

lpOptMACBridgeFunctions.name: lpOptMACBridgeFunctions
lpOptMACBridgeFunctions.description: Indicates the MAC's optional bridging functions. The Value -1 is used to indicate that bridging is not supported by this MAC. The value is a sum. This value initially takes the value zero, then for each function present, 2 raised to a power is added to the sum. The powers are according to the following table: Function Power tb 0 -- Transparent bridging active sr 1 -- Src routing active srt 2 -- Src routing transparent active

lpOptMACTPriTable.name: lpOptMACTPriTable
lpOptMACTPriTable.description: A list of MAC T-Pri entries.

lpOptMACTPriEntry.name: lpOptMACTPriEntry
lpOptMACTPriEntry.description: A collection of T-Pri information for a given MAC within a given SMT.

lpOptMACTPriSMTIndex.name: lpOptMACTPriSMTIndex
lpOptMACTPriSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptMACTPriMACIndex.name: lpOptMACTPriMACIndex
lpOptMACTPriMACIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the MAC object instances.

lpOptMACTPri0.name: lpOptMACTPri0
lpOptMACTPri0.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri1.name: lpOptMACTPri1
lpOptMACTPri1.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri2.name: lpOptMACTPri2
lpOptMACTPri2.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri3.name: lpOptMACTPri3
lpOptMACTPri3.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri4.name: lpOptMACTPri4
lpOptMACTPri4.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri5.name: lpOptMACTPri5
lpOptMACTPri5.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptMACTPri6.name: lpOptMACTPri6
lpOptMACTPri6.description: This attribute is an unsigned twos-complement T_pri threshold as described in the MAC standard converted to non-twos-complement form and reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptPATHRingTable.name: lpOptPATHRingTable
lpOptPATHRingTable.description: A list of PATH ring entries.

lpOptPATHRingEntry.name: lpOptPATHRingEntry
lpOptPATHRingEntry.description: Ring latency, trace status, and T-Rmode information for a given PATH within a given SMT.

lpOptPATHRingSMTIndex.name: lpOptPATHRingSMTIndex
lpOptPATHRingSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptPATHRingPATHIndex.name: lpOptPATHRingPATHIndex
lpOptPATHRingPATHIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the primary, secondary and local PATH object instances. Local PATH object instances are represented with integer values 3 to 255.

lpOptPATHRingLatency.name: lpOptPATHRingLatency
lpOptPATHRingLatency.description: Gives the total accumulated latency of the ring associated with this path. May be measured directly by the station or calculated by a management station. Values of this object are reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptPATHTraceStatus.name: lpOptPATHTraceStatus
lpOptPATHTraceStatus.description: This attribute indicates the current trace status of the path. The value is a sum which represents all of the trace status information which applies. This value initially takes the value zero, then for each condition which applies, 2 raised to a power is added to the sum. the powers are according to the following table: TraceStatus Power traceinitiated 0 tracepropragated 1 traceterminated 2 tracetimeout 3

lpOptPATHT_Rmode.name: lpOptPATHT_Rmode
lpOptPATHT_Rmode.description: Used by RMT to limit the duration of restricted dialogs on a path. This object is reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptPATHSbaTable.name: lpOptPATHSbaTable
lpOptPATHSbaTable.description: A list of PATH Sba entries.

lpOptPATHSbaEntry.name: lpOptPATHSbaEntry
lpOptPATHSbaEntry.description: Sba information for a given PATH within a given SMT.

lpOptPATHSbaSMTIndex.name: lpOptPATHSbaSMTIndex
lpOptPATHSbaSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptPATHSbaPATHIndex.name: lpOptPATHSbaPATHIndex
lpOptPATHSbaPATHIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the primary, secondary and local PATH object instances. Local PATH object instances are represented with integer values 3 to 255.

lpOptPATHSbaPayload.name: lpOptPATHSbaPayload
lpOptPATHSbaPayload.description: The payload portion of the Synchronous Bandwidth Allocation for thi path. This value represents the maximum number of bytes of data allocated for transmission per 125 microseconds.

lpOptPATHSbaOverhead.name: lpOptPATHSbaOverhead
lpOptPATHSbaOverhead.description: The overhead portion of the Synchronous Bandwith Allocation for this path. This value repersents the maximum number of bytes overhead (token capture, frame header, etc.) used pre negotiated Target Token Rotation Time (T_neg).

lpOptPATHSbaAvailable.name: lpOptPATHSbaAvailable
lpOptPATHSbaAvailable.description: This value is the maximum Synchronous Bandwith available for a path in bytes per second.

lpOptPORTTable.name: lpOptPORTTable
lpOptPORTTable.description: A list of optional PORT entries.

lpOptPORTEntry.name: lpOptPORTEntry
lpOptPORTEntry.description: MAC loop time and EB error count information for a given PORT within a given SMT.

lpOptPORTSMTIndex.name: lpOptPORTSMTIndex
lpOptPORTSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptPORTIndex.name: lpOptPORTIndex
lpOptPORTIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the PORT object instances.

lpOptPORTMACLoopTime.name: lpOptPORTMACLoopTime
lpOptPORTMACLoopTime.description: This attribute controls the value used for T_Next(9) (see 9.4.4.2.3). This object is reported in 1 ns units.

lpOptPORTEBErrorCt.name: lpOptPORTEBErrorCt
lpOptPORTEBErrorCt.description: A count that should as closely as possible match the times an Elasticity Buffer Error has occurred while in active line state.

lpOptPORTLSTable.name: lpOptPORTLSTable
lpOptPORTLSTable.description: A list of optional PORT line state entries.

lpOptPORTLSEntry.name: lpOptPORTLSEntry
lpOptPORTLSEntry.description: Maintenance line state and PC line state information for a given PORT within a given SMT.

lpOptPORTLSSMTIndex.name: lpOptPORTLSSMTIndex
lpOptPORTLSSMTIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of snmpFddiSMTNumber. The value for each SMT must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

lpOptPORTLSPORTIndex.name: lpOptPORTLSPORTIndex
lpOptPORTLSPORTIndex.description: Index variable for uniquely identifying the PORT object instances.

lpOptPORTMaintLS.name: lpOptPORTMaintLS
lpOptPORTMaintLS.description: The PORT Maintenance Line State specifies the line state (Maint_LS) to be transmitted when the PCM state machine for the port is in state PC9 Maint.

lpOptPORTPCLS.name: lpOptPORTPCLS
lpOptPORTPCLS.description: This attribute indicates the line state (PC_LS) received by the port.

lpOptSMTHoldCondition.name: lpOptSMTHoldCondition
lpOptSMTHoldCondition.description: Generated when fddiSMTHoldState (fddimibSMTHoldState) assumes the state holding-prm or holding-sec. This notification is a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptSMTPeerWrapCondition.name: lpOptSMTPeerWrapCondition
lpOptSMTPeerWrapCondition.description: This condition is active when fddiSMTPeerWrapFlag (fddimibSMTPeerWrapFlag) is set. This notification is a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptMACDuplicateAddressCondition.name: lpOptMACDuplicateAddressCondition
lpOptMACDuplicateAddressCondition.description: This condition is active when either fddiMACDA-Flag (fddimibMACDaFlag) or fddiMACUNDA-Flag (fddimibMACUnaDaFlag) is set. This event is handled as a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptMACFrameErrorCondition.name: lpOptMACFrameErrorCondition
lpOptMACFrameErrorCondition.description: Generated when the fddiMACFrameErrorRatio (fddimibMACFrameErrorRatio) is greater than or equal to fddiMACFrameErrorThreshold (fddimibMACFrameErrorThreshold). This event is handled as a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptMACNotCopiedCondition.name: lpOptMACNotCopiedCondition
lpOptMACNotCopiedCondition.description: Generated when the fddiMACNotCopiedRatio (fddimibMACNotCopiedRatio) is greater than or equal to the fddiMACNotCopiedThreshold (lpOptMACNotCopiedThreshold). This event is handled as a Condition in the Status Report Protocol (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptMACNeighborChangeEvent.name: lpOptMACNeighborChangeEvent
lpOptMACNeighborChangeEvent.description: Generated when a change in a MAC's upstream neighbor address or downstream neighbor address is detected. (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptMACPathChangeEvent.name: lpOptMACPathChangeEvent
lpOptMACPathChangeEvent.description: This event is generated when the value of the fddiMACCurrentPath (fddimibMACCurrentPath) changes. This event shall be supressed if the value changes from isolated to local or local to isolated (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptPORTLerCondition.name: lpOptPORTLerCondition
lpOptPORTLerCondition.description: This condition becomes active when the value of fddiPORTLer-Estimate (fddimibPORTLerEstimate) is less than or equal to fddiPORTLer-Alarm (fddimibPORTLerAlarm). This will be reported with the Status Report Frames (SRF) (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptPORTUndesiredConnAttemptEvent.name: lpOptPORTUndesiredConnAttemptEvent
lpOptPORTUndesiredConnAttemptEvent.description: Generated when an undesired connection attempt has been made (see 5.2.4, 7.2.7, and 8.3).

lpOptPORTEBErrorCondition.name: lpOptPORTEBErrorCondition
lpOptPORTEBErrorCondition.description: Generated when the Elasticity Buffer Error-Ct (lpOptPORTEBErrorCt) increments. This is handled as a condition in the Status Report Protocol. It is generated when an increment occurs in the station's sampling period (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).

lpOptPORTPathChangeEvent.name: lpOptPORTPathChangeEvent
lpOptPORTPathChangeEvent.description: This event is generated when the value of the fddiPORTCurrentPath (lpOptPORTCurrentPath) changes. This event shall be surpressed if the value changes from isolated to local or local to isolated (see 7.2.7 and 8.3).
